definition: to have a voracious desire for/to covet/greedy/corrupt

sentences.english: Most embezzlers are found out in the end.
sentences.chinese: 大多數貪污犯最後都被查出。

sentences.english: "No to corruption," they say. "No to dictatorship."
sentences.chinese: 示威者提出“不要貪污，不要專政”。

sentences.english: He muckraked his political rivals with great relish.
sentences.chinese: 他興致勃勃地揭發政敵的貪污腐化。

sentences.english: Her parents were falsely accuse is criminal.
sentences.chinese: 她父母還被誣賴是貪污犯。

sentences.english: The people asked the government to hit out against corruption and theft.
sentences.chinese: 人民要求政府嚴懲貪污盜竊。

sentences.english: Work harder to build an honest government, punish graft and corruption
sentences.chinese: 加強廉政建設，懲治貪污腐敗。

sentences.english: Gerakan Youth pledges its strongest support to the government to fight corruption.
sentences.chinese: 民青團將大力支持政府打擊貪污。

sentences.english: Then wait Alexeyevich Prague will be charged with the crime of corruption.
sentences.chinese: 接下來等待布拉格耶維奇，將是貪污罪的控告。

sentences.english: He is counted as a national hero.
sentences.chinese: 那個國家發起了一場全國性的反貪污運動。

sentences.english: They were embezzling funds right under his nose.
sentences.chinese: 他們就在他眼皮子底下把公款貪污了。

sentences.english: Mr. Hardy was a grafter indeed.
sentences.chinese: 哈迪先生實際上是個貪污犯。

sentences.english: Of them, 735 complaints involved building management.
sentences.chinese: 其中，有關樓宇管理的貪污舉報735宗。

sentences.english: The head of the county has been detained for interrogation due to corruption and bribery.
sentences.chinese: 這個縣長已經因爲貪污受賄而被拿問了。

sentences.english: The problem is not simply one of embezzlement and bribery.
sentences.chinese: 問題不僅僅是挪用公款和貪污受賄那麼簡單。

sentences.english: Their new accounting system will help clip the wings of any would-be embezzlers.
sentences.chinese: 他們的新會計制度有助於杜絕可能發生的貪污行爲。

definition: to hold accountable/to blame/to censure/to apportion blame
lack of discipline/to break a rule/to violate discipline/to breach a principle
